PROJECT435

  • database2 module
  • View page source

database2 module

Module that contains functions for connecting to and managing an SQLite3 database for an ecommerce inventory.

database2.add_item(item)[source]

Inserts a new item record into the ‘inventory’ table.

Parameters:

item (dict) – A dictionary containing the item’s details, including name, category, price_per_item, description, and count_in_stock.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the inserted item’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.

database2.connect_to_db()[source]

Establishes a connection to the database ‘ecommerce_inventory.db’.

Returns:

The established connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

database2.create_inventory_table()[source]

Creates a table named ‘inventory’ in the database if it does not already exist.

The table contains columns for item_id, name, category, price_per_item, description, and count_in_stock.

database2.deduce_item_from_stock(item_id, quantity)[source]

Deducts a specified quantity from the item’s stock.

Parameters:

  • item_id (int) – The unique identifier for the item.

  • quantity (int) – The quantity to be deducted from the item’s stock.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated item’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.

database2.get_all_items()[source]

Retrieves all items from the ‘inventory’ table.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents an item.

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.

database2.get_item_by_id(item_id)[source]

Retrieves an item from the ‘inventory’ table by its item_id.

Parameters:

item_id (int) – The unique identifier for the item.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the item’s details.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.

database2.get_item_by_name(item_name)[source]

Retrieves an item from the ‘inventory’ table by its name.

Parameters:

item_name (str) – The name of the item.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the item’s details or None if the item is not found.

Return type:

dict or None

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.

database2.update_item(item_id, updates)[source]

Updates an item in the ‘inventory’ table.

Parameters:

  • item_id (int) – The unique identifier for the item to be updated.

  • updates (dict) – A dictionary containing the fields to be updated and their new values.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated item’s details or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception if an error occurs during the database operation.
